intro: Solenospermum paucinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined solenospermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly found in countries like India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent venation patterns. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
